events.originalText: Planted by unknown perpetrators, a bomb exploded at LaGuardia Airport in New York City, killing 11 people and seriously injuring 74 others.
events.subtitle: 1975 LaGuardia Airport bombing
events.headline: Bomb Explodes at LaGuardia Airport in NYC, Killing 11

events.originalText: American physicist Richard Feynman gave a speech entitled "There's Plenty of Room at the Bottom" at Caltech, anticipating the field of nanotechnology.
events.subtitle: Richard Feynman
events.headline: Physicist Richard Feynman Anticipates Nanotechnology at Caltech Speech

events.originalText: Second World War: The Luftwaffe began a major night bombing raid on the British capital as part of the Blitz, beginning what was later called the "Second Great Fire of London".
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Luftwaffe Begins Major Night Bombing Raid on London During Blitz

events.originalText: The Constitution of Ireland, the founding legal document of the state known today as the Republic of Ireland, came into force.
events.subtitle: Constitution of Ireland
events.headline: Constitution of Ireland Comes into Force

events.originalText: The Northern Expedition, a military campaign by the National Revolutionary Army of the Kuomintang, ended with the complete control of the Republic of China.
events.subtitle: Northern Expedition
events.headline: Northern Expedition Ends with Kuomintang Control of Republic of China

events.originalText: First World War: The French parliament passed a law granting the land occupied by British war graves as "the free gift of the French people".
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: French Parliament Grants Land for British War Graves

events.originalText: Cecil B. DeMille started filming Hollywood's first feature film, The Squaw Man (featured).
events.subtitle: Cecil B. DeMille
events.headline: Cecil B. DeMille Films Hollywood's First Feature Film, The Squaw Man

events.originalText: Sioux Wars: The United States Army killed 250 to 300 Lakota men, women and children at the Wounded Knee Massacre, beginning the Ghost Dance War.
events.subtitle: Sioux Wars
events.headline: United States Army Kills 250-300 Lakota at Wounded Knee Massacre

events.originalText: A railway bridge collapsed over the Ashtabula River in Ohio, killing 92 people and injuring 64 others on a Lake Shore and Michigan Southern Railway train.
events.subtitle: Ashtabula River railroad disaster
events.headline: Railway Bridge Collapse in Ohio Kills 92

events.originalText: To counter the French Navy's Gloire, the world's first ironclad warship, the Royal Navy launched HMS Warrior, the world's first iron-hulled armoured warship.
events.subtitle: French Navy
events.headline: Royal Navy Launches HMS Warrior, First Iron-Hulled Armoured Warship

events.originalText: The Republic of Texas was annexed by the United States, becoming the 28th state to be admitted to the Union.
events.subtitle: Republic of Texas
events.headline: Republic of Texas Annexed by United States as 28th State

events.originalText: War of 1812: In a three-hour single-ship action, HMS Java (drawing shown) was captured by USS Constitution off the coast of Brazil.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: USS Constitution Captures HMS Java in War of 1812 Battle

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Lieutenant Colonel Archibald Campbell led a contingent of British soldiers to capture the city of Savannah, Georgia.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British Capture Savannah, Georgia in American Revolutionary War
